questions.question: The best definition of a sole trader is a business that

choices.answer: only employs one person
is owned by one person
has a single customer
is a single firm in the industry

questions.question: One of the advantages of a sole trader business is that

choices.answer: owners have limited liability
shares can be sold to raise capital
decisions and responsibilities can be shared
the owner has complete control over decision making

questions.question: One disadvantage of a sole trader business is that

choices.answer: capital is limited to the owner's savings and bank loans
decisions take too long to make
owners may disagree

questions.question: One of the advantages of a partnership is that

choices.answer: all partners have limited liability
shares can be sold on the Stock Exchange
the business can survive the death of the partners
the business has access to more capital than a sole trader

questions.question: Which of the following is not a feature of a private limited company?

choices.answer: Shares can be issued to raise capital
Shares can be bought  and sold on the Stock Exchange
All owners of the business have limited liability
The business continues after the death of a shareholder

questions.question: The main reason why an entrepreneur will convert an LTD into a PLC is

choices.answer: they don't want to remain in the private sector
they want to gain the benefits of limited liability
they want to keep the annual accounts secret
they want to raise additional capital to expand the business

questions.question: One of the main disadvantages of a PLC is the

choices.answer: loss of control by the owners as additional shares are sold
firms in the public sector are often less efficient
possibility that if a company fails owners might lose assets

questions.question: Which of the following statements about PLCs is most true

choices.answer: The firm is owned and controlled by the workers
The firm is owned by the directors but run by shareholders
The firm is owned by shareholders and run by directors
THe firm is owned and controlled by the government

questions.question: One of the reasons an entrepreneur might buy a franchise is

choices.answer: it is cheaper than setting up a new business venture
there is complete control over important decisions
the business can use its own name in advertisments
the risk of failure is lower

questions.question: What is the advantage to a business of selling a franchise license to franchisee?

choices.answer: The business can expand more quickly
The franchisor owns all of the shops
The business buying the franchise is likely to be successful

questions.question: One of the disadvantages of an entrepreneur buying a new franchise is

choices.answer: the profits of the franchisor's business will be lower
a share of the set up costs will be paid to the franchisor
not all decisions are taken by the franchisee
consumers are less likley to have heard of the franchise

questions.question: All of the following are advantages of joint ventures except

choices.answer: The cost of a new project can be split between companies
Manufacturing costs will be divided between the firms
Joint venture companues can enjoy economies of scale
Management of a joint venture might cause disagreement
